pages.text: There are several ways to increase your inventory space or help condense what you're carrying, described here.

pages.title: Packages
pages.text: Packages can be constructed in the Package Crafter block. These can store up to 512 of any one thing, and can be interacted with in the inventory similarly to a bundle. Additionally, packages can store other packages, allowing you to store vast amounts of a single item in one slot.

pages.title: Packages (cont.)
pages.text: Packages are also placeable, and can be manipulated similarly to shulker boxes - pistons crush them, dispensers place them, and items may be inserted or extracted from them.

pages.title: Storage Trinkets
pages.text: You can equip, in your trinket slots, up to two Pouches and one Satchel, which physically expand your inventory space. They retain their inventory when taken off, as well.

pages.title: Bundles
pages.text: Bundles are craftable, and in addition to their vanilla behavior, you may scroll with the mousewheel over them to cycle the items inside.

pages.title: Hoarding
pages.text: When mining, you find plenty of ore and treasure, but also plenty of other blocks like stone. You may not prefer to throw them away, but there may come a point when packages are not enough to carry them home. Thus, these two items are specifically for carrying a large amount of one thing - such as stone.
